intro: Stichorkis benguetensis, commonly known as the Benguet stichorkis, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in clusters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions.
